did.abstract: William Colfax Miller (1911-1995) was a veteran of the Spanish Civil War. The William Colfax Miller Papers consists of items formerly bound in a scrapbook, dating from 1936 to 1945, including photos, leaflets, flyers, postcards, uniform patches, and clippings that document the experience of an Abraham Lincoln Brigade volunteer in Spain and after returning to the United States.
did.langmaterial: Materials are in English and Spanish.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: William Colfax Miller (1911-1995) was a veteran of the Spanish Civil War. From 1938 to 1939, he served in the Abraham Lincoln Brigade, Lincoln-Washington Battalion, Machine Gun Company, Rank Soldado.
Source: "Miller, William Colfax." Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade, https://alba-valb.org/volunteers/william-colfax-miller/.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The William Colfax Miller Papers were donated to Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives by William Miller in 1974. The collection came to New York University in January 2001 as part of the original acquisition of Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives collections, formerly housed at Brandeis University.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives (ALBA), were transferred to New York University in November 2000 by the ALBA Board of Governors. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives. For more information, contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.

processinfo.p: Processing decisions made prior to 2025 are unknown. In January 2025, conservators rehoused materials from the scrapbook that constitued the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The William Colfax Miller Papers date from circa 1936 to 1945 and consist of a disbound scrapbook that contained photographs, leaflets, flyers, postcards, uniform patches, a poster (folded), and post-Spanish Civil War and pre-World War II-era copies of the New Masses. As a whole, the contents of the scrapbook document the experience of an Abraham Lincoln Brigade volunteer in Spain and after returning to the United States with official forms and correspondence, flyers for benefits and public events, and postcards that reproduce well-known Spanish Civil War posters. The collection also contains some post-Spanish Civil War material memorializing the International Brigades in Mexico. Also included is Friends of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade social service support information for volunteers returning to New York City in 1939.
